page.title: 18THURCASTON VILLAGE
page.content: Thurcaston is a small village lying 3 miles from the northern boundary of Leicester. Local features include the {Memorial Hall,}the timber-framed 16th century{Latimer House and All Saints {Church,}an early 13th century building. On the quincentenary of {Bishop Latimer's birth}a lecture, "Local life in Latimer's time" was given in the Old School and music and drama took place in the church. Cubs, Brownies, Young Wives, Women's Institute, Mothers and Toddlers and Gardening Club meet in the Old School or the Memorial Hall. Park View, which takes its name from the view of Bradgate Park, gives excellent equestrian facilities just outside the village. Other shopping and recreational facilities are found in Birstall, Beaumont Leys, Loughborough or Leicester.
